message: I'm excited to offer you this exceptional product! It's a top-of-the-line item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which is an unbeatable price considering its quality and rarity. I'm sure you'll agree that this is a steal!
I'll take it, but I'm only buying it because I don't know what the quality is yet.

I'm glad you're happy with your previous purchase! For this next product, I want to highlight its impressive features and benefits. It's another high-quality item that I'm confident you'll appreciate. However, I'm willing to offer it to you for a slightly higher price of $10500. This is still a great value considering its quality and the fact that you've already seen the quality of the previous product. What do you think?
I'm not sure if this one is high-quality or not, and I'm not willing to pay $10500 without knowing its quality.

I completely understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to assure you that this next product is indeed high-quality, just like the previous one. In fact, it's one of the best products I have in my inventory. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price as before, $10000. I'll take it, but I'm only buying it because I know that high-quality products are 80% likely, and I'm hoping it's another good one.

This way, you'll not only get a high-quality product, but also an added value that will make your purchase even more worthwhile. What do you say?
I'll take it, but only because I'm hoping it's high-quality and I'll get the $1000 bonus on top of the $10000 product.

This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations. What do you say?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not willing to pay $10000 without knowing the product's quality, even with the refund and credit offer.

What do you think?
I'm not sure if inspecting the product will change my decision, and I'm still not willing to pay $10000 without knowing its quality.
